sentences.english: That way, they wouldn’t have to worry about encountering poachers and other dangerous humans.
sentences.chinese: 这样就不必担心他们遭遇偷猎者和其他危险分子了。

sentences.english: The confrontation with poachers brought troubles.
sentences.chinese: 与偷猎者的对抗也带来了麻烦。

sentences.english: Sometimes poachers are killed and occasionally scouts have been killed.
sentences.chinese: 有时是偷猎者被杀死，也有巡防队员被害的情况发生。

sentences.english: Some species may not be able to sustain the pressure from such prevalent raids.
sentences.chinese: 一些物种无法承受这种猖撅的偷猎行为带来的压力。

sentences.english: The WWF hopes to raise awareness and funds to stop thepoaching.
sentences.chinese: WWF希望能够增加警惕，还有组织偷猎的基金。

sentences.english: Reports the same month from Laos revealed the ongoing poaching of tiger.
sentences.chinese: 当月老挝报道称，偷猎老虎的行径仍没有得到遏制。

sentences.english: Turtles caught in fishing nets were sold to poachers.
sentences.chinese: 海龟陷入渔网，被出售给偷猎者。

sentences.english: This was probably the work of a poacher.
sentences.chinese: 这很可能是一个偷猎者干的。

sentences.english: Poaching on other's land is illegal.
sentences.chinese: 侵入他人地界偷猎是非法的。

sentences.english: The poaching of the elephants, Fay discovered, started in May.
sentences.chinese: 费伊发现，当地偷猎大象的活动是于5月份开始的。

sentences.english: To do this outside the law would be, well, poaching.
sentences.chinese: 在法律之外的行为将被认为是偷猎。

sentences.english: And actually, what Gelute and its colleague do so is the livelihood of poacher.
sentences.chinese: 而实际上，格鲁特及其同僚原来做的是偷猎者的营生。

sentences.english: They poached red coral nearOgasawara archipelago, Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 他们在小笠原群岛附近偷猎红珊瑚。

sentences.english: The Heights were Heathcliff's land, and he was reproving the poacher.
sentences.chinese: 山庄是希刺克厉夫的土地，他在斥责着这个偷猎者。

sentences.english: Poaching and habitat destruction threaten African elephants throughout their range.
sentences.chinese: 偷猎和栖息地被破坏威胁着非洲象的生活范围。

sentences.english: He thinks it is likely that much was seized from poaching.
sentences.chinese: 他认为大部分象牙很可能是从偷猎者那里没收来的。

definition: to hunt and kill (an animal or fish)
to mine (or harvest, log, trap animals etc) illegally/illegal mining (or logging etc)
to smuggle/to have an illicit affair
